document.docAuthor: Calderón-Martínez, Nadia R., González-Obando, Ranulfo & García Aldrete, Alfonso N.
document.masterDocTitle: Descriptions and records of Cladiopsocidae and Dolabellopsocidae (Insecta: Psocodea: ‘ Psocoptera’) from Valle del Cauca and National Natural Park Gorgona, Colombia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Descriptions and records of Cladiopsocidae and Dolabellopsocidae (Insecta: Psocodea: ‘ Psocoptera’) from Valle del Cauca and National Natural Park Gorgona, Colombia

heading.emphasis: Key to the neotropical species of Dolabellopsocidae (males)

subSubSection.paragraph:
The key does not include
Dolabellopsocus ecuadorensis Eertmoed
,
D. guttatus Eertmoed
and
D. pygmaeus (New)
, of which only females are known, as well as
D. flavipennis (Roesler)
and
Isthmopsocus imperfectus Badonnel
, the genitalia of which have not been well studied.

paragraph.keyLead:
- Forewing A 2 ends on A 1 ( Figs 70 , 80 ). Dorsal ocelli well developed (
Isthmopsocus
)
............................... 21
4 . Distal lobes of clunial comb almost of same length........................................................... 5
- Lateral lobes of clunial comb longer than median lobes........................................................ 7
5 . Clunial comb with about seven distal lobes, almost as long as wide, to each side of midline. Median excavation shallow.... 6

- Clunial comb with about five long digitiform lobes, longer than wide, to each side of midline. Median excavation deep...................................................................................
D. digitatus New & Thornton

6 . Epiproct rounded distally, posterior border slightly serrated. Pale body pigmentation..................
D. ctenatus (New)

- Epiproct truncate distally, with well developed distal papillar field. Dark body pigmentation...........
D. similis Mockford

7 . Epiproct rounded distally. Median excavation of clunial comb rounded.....................
D. furcatus New & Thornton

- Epiproct straight distally. Median excavation of clunial comb square.............................
D. lobatus Mockford

10 . Thoracic pleura with a broad rose-colored band. Vertex, frons, and clypeus uniformly rose colored......
D. roseus Eertmoed

11 . Clunial comb present. Phallobase subrectangular; apex of aedeagus surpasses apex of external parameres..................................................................................................
D. pectenatus Eertmoed

- Clunial comb absent. Phallobase subtrapeziform; apex of aedeagus not surpassing apex of external parameres (
Fig. 55
)..........................................................................................
D. roseusoides
n. sp.

12 . Forewings with pigmented bands.....................................................
D. intermedius Eertmoed

13 . Epiproct with two processes reminiscent of crab chelae.......................................
D. carcinus Mockford

14 . Paraprocts and epiproct with median papillar field..........................................
D. catenatus Mockford

- Paraprocts and epiproct with few small papillae on median edge..................................
D. pictus Mockford

15 . External parameres bilobed, two arched rows of long, curved spines in endophallus................
D. spinosus Mockford

16 . Epiproct with a medium dense field of tubercles.............................................
D. incertus Badonnel

18 . Proximal arms of parameres (phallobase arms) short and outwardly directed (
Fig. 43
)...................
D. calima
n. sp.

- Proximal arms of parameres (phallobase arms) long, parallel and directed to the center.............
D. eertmoedi Badonnel

20 . Phallobase strongly concave. Parameres apically separated. Apex of aedeagus at the same level as the apex of the parameres...................................................................................
D. maculatus Eertmoed

- Phallobase weakly concave. Parameres apically close. Apex of aedeagus extending beyond the apex of the parameres........................................................................................
D. maculosus Eertmoed

22 . Hypandrium distally bilobed, lobes well ciliated at and near apices..............................
I. barbatus Mockford

24 . Hypandrium distally rounded (
Fig. 83
). Phallosome with three phallic sclerites, two of them with a distal prong (
Fig. 84
)............................................................................................
I. foliatus
n. sp.

- Hypandrium distally straight. Phallosome frame elongate, with apical hooks and complex radular sclerites....
I. luridus New

25 . External parameres uniformly broad, curved and meeting at distal end of phallosome..............
I. speculatus Mockford
- External parameres variable, not meeting at distal end of phallosome............................................ 26

26 . Hypandrium with median longitudinal ridge in distal third, bearing two parallel rows of denticles.....
I. lanceatus Mockford

27 . Hypandrium with median apical small lobe (
Fig. 73
).........................................
I. barbatusoides
n. sp.

28 . Phallic sclerites with pronounced digitiform processes..........................................
I. breviceps (New)
- Phallic sclerites without pronounced digitiform processes..................................................... 29

29 . Hypandrium broad, with slight median insertion, bearing numerous short setae........................
I. ornatus (New)

- Hypandrium straight posteriorly, with slight lateral lobes and two papillar fields near posterior border......
I. radulatus New
